content.text:
# 11th Costume Designers Guild Awards

| location      = Beverly Wilshire Hotel, Beverly Hills, California
| country       = United States
| presenter     = Costume Designers Guild
| host          = Debra Messing
| award1_type   = Excellence in Contemporary Film:
| award1_winner = Slumdog Millionaire – Suttirat Anne Larlarb
| award2_type   = Excellence in Fantasy Film:
| award2_winner = The Dark Knight – Lindy Hemming
| award3_type   = Excellence in Period Film:
| award3_winner = The Duchess – Michael O'Connor
| previous      = 10th
| main          = CDG Awards
| next          = 12th
}}
The 11th Costume Designers Guild Awards, honouring the best costume designs in film and television for 2008, were given on February 17, 2009. The nominees were announced on January 13, 2009.
Winners and nominees
The winners are in bold.
Film
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Excellence in Contemporary Film
!style="width=50%"|Excellence in Period Film
|-
| valign="top" |
*'Slumdog Millionaire – Suttirat Larlarb'
**Iron Man – Rebecca Bentjen and Laura Jean Shannon
**Mamma Mia! – Ann Roth
**Sex and the City – Patricia Field
**The Wrestler – Amy Westcott
| valign="top" |
*'The Duchess'' – Michael O'Connor'
**Changeling – Deborah Hopper
**The Curious Case of Benjamin Button – Jacqueline West
**Milk – Danny Glicker
**Revolutionary Road – Albert Wolsky
|-
!style="width=50%" colspan="2"|Excellence in Fantasy Film
|-
|valign="top" colspan="2"|
*'The Dark Knight – Lindy Hemming'
**The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian – Isis Mussenden
**The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor – Sanja Milkovic Hays
|}
Television
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Contemporary Television
!style="width=50%"|Outstanding Period/Fantasy Television
|-
| valign="top"|
*'Ugly Betty – Eduardo Castro and Patricia Field'
**30 Rock – Tom Broecker
**Dancing with the Stars – Randall Christensen
**Entourage – Amy Westcott
**Gossip Girl – Eric Daman
| valign="top"|
*'Mad Men – Katherine Jane Bryant'
**Pushing Daisies – Robert Blackman
**The Tudors – Joan Bergin
|-
!style="width=50%" colspan="2"|Outstanding Made for Television Movie or Miniseries
|-
|valign="top" colspan="2"|
*'John Adams – Donna Zakowska'
**Bernard and Doris – Joseph G. Aulisi
**Coco Chanel – Stefano De Nardis
**Cranford – Jenny Beavan
**Sense and Sensibility'' – Michele Clapton
|}
Commercial
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!Excellence in Commercial Design
|-
| valign="top"|
*Milk, "White Gold" – Casey Storm
**Levi's, "HIS" – Kym Barrett
**NIKE, "Fate" – Donna Zakowska
|}
Special Awards
Career Achievement Award
* Marilyn Vance
* Van Broughton Ramsey
Swarovski President’s Award
* Michael Douglas
Distinguished Collaborator Award
* James Burrows
References
